10:03 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: for the 6.4.1 release we need gdelhumeau to fix the blocker issue with the HTML export.  
10:42 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: when do you think you can have it fixed?  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> I am going to work on it in a few hours, so probably not before tomorow  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> (the fix)  
10:43 <tmortagne> there is a few issues left with no documentation set  
10:43 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Wiki+Flavor+Application  
10:43 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%226.4.1%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Fixed%22%29%20and%20%28%28Documentation%20is%20EMPTY%29%20or%20%28%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY%29%29  
10:43 <vmassol> you say "This section is a bit technical and mostly designed to be used by developers who are used to the maven infrastructure." for the Add New Flavor section  
10:44 <tmortagne> mflorea, vmassol, gdelhumeau and Denis  
10:44 <vmassol> but it doesn't look technical :)  
10:44 <vmassol> also if people can't add flavors then I guess they can't use your app, right?  
10:44 <gdelhumeau> I don't know any simple user who know what a maven id is  
10:45 <vmassol> sure but then I'd put this disclaimer for the whole app as otherwise I don't see ow to seu it :)  
10:45 <vmassol> \*how  
10:45 <vmassol> \*use  
10:45 <vmassol> ah yes you're right  
10:45 <vmassol> there's the usage part of it through the wiki creation wizard  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> Actually, adding a flavor is technical  
10:45 <vmassol> ok got it  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> but if the app is already installed by an admin, a user can still create a wiki with the flavors  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> yes  
11:35 <gsmeria> has quit  
12:03 <vmassol> didn't realize DocumentTest was taking 22 seconds!  
12:03 <vmassol> Tests run: 68, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 22.533 sec - in com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocumentTest  
12:03 <vmassol> s/DocumentTest/XWikiDocumentTest  
12:04 <vmassol> way too long… we need to check why...

12:17 <mflorea> tmortagne: I'm going to document them ASAP, I just need to release the File Manager first

13:36 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
13:44 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <tmortagne> [WARN] will start 5.4.7 release in about 30min  
14:25 <tmortagne> new 6.4 blocker (regression): XWIKI-11747  
14:29 <vmassol> :(  
14:29 <vmassol> who can work on it?  
14:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: is this a regression? I see you removed the 6.2.5 affetcs  
14:32 <vmassol> sorry  
14:32 <tmortagne> I hit that on 6.4, it was just the wrong affect  
14:32 <vmassol> it's now tagged as regression  
14:32 <vmassol> mflorea: since it's AWM do you think you could have a quick look into it?  
14:32 <tmortagne> and yes it's a regression because I have application with accents in my wiki, just not sure when it was broken exactly  
14:33 <mflorea> yes, I can take a look  
14:33 <vmassol> not sure it's related to AWM per see though  
14:33 <tmortagne> I think the bug is in the code that generate the edit URL  
14:33 <tmortagne> double escaping of the template  
14:33 <mflorea> let me try to reproduce  
14:34 <tmortagne> mflorea: the step by step I indicated was on a standard jetty/hsqldb 6.4  
14:38 <mflorea> I can reproduce, checking..  
14:39 <tmortagne> [WARN] Starting 5.4.7 release  
14:50 <mflorea> vmassol, tmortagne: my fault https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6db5d4eb3fb33a20271a1b42e524c47d448e73d2 . I didn't look carefully enough one live above to see that the template name is already URL-encoded  
14:50 <mflorea> fixing  
14:52 <vmassol> ok cool  
14:52 <vmassol> mflorea: we don't have a test for that in AWM tests?  
14:52 <vmassol> (ie verify we can create entries with special chars)  
14:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: not entry, application  
14:52 <vmassol> ok  
14:53 <vmassol> maybe worth adding one then if it's not too long :)  
14:54 <tmortagne> would be better or even convert the current one to have some UTF8 char in the application name  
14:55 <tmortagne> if it works with it it should work without :)  
14:55 <mflorea> I will do that  
15:05 <mflorea> vmassol: build is failing on enterprise-test-ui, it seems you removed AbstractAdminAuthenticatedTest but you did not update the tests that were using it  
15:06 <vmassol> hmm I must have missed them then because I did a search and fixed the places using it  
15:06 <vmassol> I'll fix this thanks  
15:08 <vmassol> I've been trying to check ci.xwiki.org for the past 3 days and it almost alwayf ail...  
15:08 <vmassol> (still can't access it now)  
15:08 <vmassol> mflorea: you know what module is fialing so that i can reproduce locally?  
15:09 <mflorea> yes, xwiki-enterprise-test-ui  
15:09 <vmassol> thanks  
15:12 <vmassol> ok I think I know the problem. I didn't have the integration-tests profile turned on  in my IDE for enterprise modules… this is why the usage search didn't reveal any of those  
15:22 <msmeria> has quit

15:41 <tmortagne> mflorea: thanks, works well
